solution_line_template: Claire has {total_flowers} - {num_tulips} = <<{total_flowers}-{num_tulips}={num_roses}>>{num_roses} roses in her garden.
One-half of the red roses is equal to {fraction_to_sell} x {num_red_roses} = <<{fraction_to_sell}*{num_red_roses}={roses_to_sell}>>{roses_to_sell}.
Therefore, Claire will earn ${value_per_red_rose} x {roses_to_sell} = ${total_earnings} if she can sell 1/2 of the total number of red roses.
